Robert "Bob" Williams }} '''The Bama Band''' is an American [[country music]] group composed of Lamar Morris (vocals, guitar), Wayne "Animal" Turner (guitar), "Cowboy" Eddie Long (steel guitar), Jerry McKinney (saxophone), Vernon Derrick (fiddle), Ray Barrickman (bass), [[Billy Earheart]] (keyboards) and William Claude Marshall (drums). For more than twenty years, the Bama Band was the backing band for [[Hank Williams, Jr.]][{{Allmusic|class=artist|id=p1516|pure_url=yes}} The Bama Band Biography] The Bama Band was nominated twice for Band of the Year by the [[Academy of Country Music]].[http://www.billyearheart.com/bebama.htm Billy Earheart] They also found success on the ''[[Billboard (magazine)|Billboard]]'' [[Hot Country Songs|Hot Country Singles]] chart in the 1980s with singles like "Dallas," "Tijuana Sunrise" and "What Used to Be Crazy."
